lines: You are sitting in your highchair and eating your lunch, which consists of crackers, strained peas and a mug of milk. You are just learning how to eat with utensils.
#PICK UP SUZY FANTASTIK PLASTIC DRINKING CUP
#PICK UP SUZY FANTASTIK PLASTIC DRINKING CUP

You are in a bad mood. You were disturbed right in the middle of an exciting game of blocks. Poseable Suzy Fantastik would understand. You hold the plastic mug high over your head. It is full of milk. Mother says, "Put the mug down
on the table before you spill it."
Suzy Fantastik away! You zoom Suzy Fantastik over your head, showering the kitchen with milk.
Mom doesn't notice the mess until she slips on it and lands right on the floor. Fortunately, she doesn't get hurt, but she DOES yell. It hurts your ears and you begin to cry. You were bad.

You get caught. Not even Suzy Fantastik can help you out of this mess. You get yelled at, but worse, Mom starts to feed you the way mothers do when they are mad. You barely get a chance to swallow your food. Yech!
Mom says, "Don't you tell me 'NO,' young lady. I am your MOTHER." You don't really understand what she is saying, so you say:
Smart. Don't get her temper up; she's having a rough day. You've saved yourself some emotional duress.

Lifting the milk with both hands, you attempt to find your mouth. You make the connection. The milk fills your tiny mouth very quickly and spills down around your chin. You try to put the cup down on the tray, but it tips dangerously.
The cup rocks back and forth but remains upright. Your mother is saved from having to wipe up a spill.
The cup rocks twice, then falls off the tray and bounces off the floor several times. Your mother is aggravated, but can't take it out on you. You were trying.
You are put into your room and told not to come out until you can behave yourself.
Using hatchet-like strokes, you pulverize the cracker until it is unrecognizable.
#YELL AND POUND ON THE HIGHCHAIR TRAY
#QUIETLY SPRINKLE THE CRUMBS ALL OVER THE FLOOR
Sometimes children your age just go wild for no apparent reason. Some parents will let you act out, as long as you are not doing anything dangerous to yourself.
Yours will not. Your mother is getting rapidly annoyed and gives you the "cut-it-out-or-else" look.
Since your parents aren't very strict, your mother tries to ride this one out.
#LIFT THE HIGHCHAIR TRAY AND SLAM IT DOWN
CRASH! You have decided to test the limits. Your mother gets very annoyed. You are sentenced to an afternoon nap. The crime: crankiness.
You have just avoided a premature nap.
All of the characteristics related to extreme sneakiness and hostility have increased. Your actions will not be detected until the next time someone sweeps the floor. How do you feel about this?
You are sneakier than I thought. What kind of adult will you turn out to be if you keep this up?
Don't feel too guilty. You're just a kid, remember? I'll fix some of your negative scores. That should make you feel a little better.
Your mom pulled you away from a block-building session that you didn't want to end. When her back is turned, you lift the highchair tray and slip under it.
You hit the floor with a loud thump.
Nothing (not even a sore bottom) can stop you now. You are headed for daylight. You go for the toy chest with the speed of a charging buffalo. You encounter a large leg.

You fake left and move right. Your mom is caught temporarily off guard and once again you are unobstructed. Your confidence increases, even though you are eventually caught and dragged back to the highchair.

Admit it. You're outwitted (but not for long). You could have kept trying. Persistence sometimes does have its rewards. Your judgment seems pretty good, though, even at your age. You are taken back to your highchair.
Crying only puts your mom in a bad mood. See how easy it is to get a person to feel angry when you are angry yourself?
You are put back in the chair.
First you put the back end of the spoon in your mouth. You then lift the cup with both hands and try blowing through the spoon as if it were a straw. Nothing happens.
#KEEP PLAYING WITH THE SPOON AND CUP

Curiosity and persistence are early signs of an inventive personality. One day during late childhood you may find yourself attempting to re-wire the electric hairdryer and have a shocking experience. For now you:
#STIR THE MILK RAPIDLY WITH THE SPOON
#PLACE THE SPOON INSIDE THE CUP AND TIP THE HIGHCHAIR TRAY FORWARD

It makes bubbles! It bounces out of the cup and hits you in the face! It causes the cup to fly off the tray and spill all over the floor! This is great. Your mother fails to understand the true significance of your discoveries, but

Daredevil acts like this will probably be very common in your life. Please try to approach them with (at least) a concern for your own well-being, if not for the well-being of others. After two close calls, the spoon and cup spill all
over you. You suffer temporary physical distress (mild) because you have to be cleaned and changed. You make your mother annoyed.
The strained peas look interesting. You can:
Ugh! They are terrible. Physical stress increases, slightly. Unfortunately, Mom feeds you the rest.

First, you use the spoon to cover a small amount of the tray with the strained peas. (Congratulations, you have learned to use a spoon.) Next, you take the mug and press it down on your pile of strained peas. Look at how the peas
squish out from underneath the mug.
This isn't so bad. The milk is actually quite good. Physically, you are quite satisfied.

You will probably do much traveling when you get older. This isn't bad, provided that you are not traveling to avoid responsibility. You slip out of the chair but hit the floor much harder than you expected.

Mom comes over to make sure that you are not hurt. No bad bruises or broken bones. You get a lot of sympathy. This makes you feel good. The pain goes away. ("No more 'boo-boo,'" Mom says.) Would you like to try to crawl away again?
Good idea. Mom stays and helps you learn how to eat with the right utensils. You will probably have excellent manners in restaurants when you grow up.
